name: Oscar Pettiford
description:
'''Oscar Pettiford''' (September 30, 1922 â€“ September 8, 1960) was an American [[jazz]] [[double bass]]ist and composer. He was one of the earliest musicians to work in the [[bebop]] idiom.

Jazz bassist [[Christian McBride]] called Pettiford "probably the most important bass player of that bebop generation in terms of creating new language for the bass."
